basics.name: Enda Flynn
basics.label: Data Scientist
basics.summary: A data scientist with a passion for machine learning, data analysis, automation, and problem solving. I have extensive experience in Python, R, and SQL among other technologies. In addition to this, I have a strong background in mathematics and statistics with a history of exceptional academic achievement.

work.name: Allied Irish Banks
work.summary: Leading and developing workstream for tuning detection scenarios to reduce FPRs and alerts using machine learning and explainable AI. As part of this workstream I manage two direct reports.

courses: 4.0 GPA. Modules include Statistical Machine Learning, Bayesian Analysis, and Data Programming in Python / R / C++.
First Class Honours. Achieved the highest results at degree level (Overall Final Mark: 86.3%).

awards.title: John M Forde Medal for Mathematical Sciences 2020
awards.summary: The John M Forde Medal for Mathematical Sciences is awarded by TU Dublin to the student with the highest exam results at degree level on the BSc (Hons) Mathematical Sciences programme.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
